Package cycling

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    CyclingPortal
    CyclingPortal interface.
    MiniCyclingPortal
    MiniCyclingPortal interface.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Checkpoint
    Abstract class for a checkpoint.
    Climb
    The Climb class is a subclass of Checkpoint and is used to represent a climb in a stage.
    CyclingPortalImpl
    This class is the implementation of the CyclingPortal interface.
    Entity
    Represents an entity with a unique ID.
    IntermediateSprint
    Represents an intermediate sprint checkpoint.
    PointsHandler<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
    This handles the sorting and ranking of points/times to riderIds using generic types for modularity.
    Race
    Class to represent an entire Race in the system.
    Rider
    Class holding riders' details.
    SerializedData
    This class is used to serialize the data of the CyclingPortalImpl portal instance.
    Stage
    Class to represent a stage in the staged bike race.
    Team
    Class holding teams, their name, description and riders within.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    CheckpointType
    This enum is used to represent the checkpoint types within stages on road races.
    StageType
    This enum is used to represent the stage types on road races.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    DuplicatedResultException
    Each rider can only have a single result in a race.
    IDNotRecognisedException
    Thrown when attempting to use an ID that does not exit in the system.
    IllegalNameException
    Thrown when attempting to assign a race name already in use in the system.
    InvalidCheckpointTimesException
    Each race result should contains the times for each checkpoint (mountain and sprint) within a stage, plus the start time and the finish time.
    InvalidLengthException
    Thrown when attempting to assign a race length null or less than 5 (kilometres).
    InvalidLocationException
    Thrown when attempting to assign a location outside the bounds of the stage, i.e.
    InvalidNameException
    Thrown when attempting to assign an entity name null, empty or having more than the system limit of characters.
    InvalidStageStateException
    Thrown when attempting to perform an action within a stage that is incompatible with its current state.
    InvalidStageTypeException
    Thrown when attempting to add checkpoints (sprints or mountains) to a time-trial stage.
    NameNotRecognisedException
    Thrown when attempting to use a name that does not exit in the system.
